assessments.status_rationale: Today’s coverage focuses on a Supreme Court rebuke and Trump stating he will raise the global tariff to 15% “effective immediately,” which implies an operational tariff regime. However, the news bullets do not provide clear evidence of CBP issuing a CSMS message and/or Federal Register notice establishing collection procedures and an effective date for a new broadly applied 10% tariff specifically. Confirmation would require checking CBP CSMS and/or the Federal Register for the referenced implementation guidance.

No item in today’s bullets reports an official retaliation announcement by the EU/Canada/Mexico/China/Japan/South Korea tied specifically to the U.S. global tariff, nor a stated coverage amount ≥$10B.
Today’s bullets do not include the Monthly Treasury Statement or any customs-duty receipt figures; cannot verify whether any month reached ≥$10.0B.
No BEA Core PCE year-over-year print is reported in today’s bullets; cannot assess whether a release hit ≥3.2%.
This is a forward-looking claim about FOMC decisions through 2026-06-30; today’s bullets do not document a rate cut or lack thereof.
No New York Fed household debt report or student-loan delinquency rate is cited in today’s bullets.
No bullet indicates EU approval of a new Ukraine financing package with EU-level borrowing/guarantees totaling ≥€50B.
Determining a 15% drawdown relative to the 2026-02-21 close requires subsequent SPX closing data; today’s bullets do not establish that condition as met.
No S&P Global LCD leveraged-loan trailing-12-month default rate figure is provided in today’s bullets.
No bullet reports a Microsoft/OpenAI announcement of a new U.S. data-center campus/project meeting the ≥1.0 GW or ≥$20B capex threshold.
